item.title: TLDR: The Precision of Sensory Evidence
item.description: In The Precision of Sensory Evidence, Scott Alexander discusses a new theory behind depression and other negative emotions. As someone who is higher in neuroticism, I’ve spent a lot of time thinking of ways to improve my mental wellbeing, but not as much on what might cause my predisposition to negative emotions in the first place. It’s a thought-provoking read, but it’s also a bit difficult to parse. This is my attempt to distill the main ideas and my personal takeaways so I can revisit them in the future.

item.title: Nobody Told Me
item.description: Nobody told me that it’s ok to pause To sit and wait for a worthy cause That you can be moving through the world or the world can be moving towards you That if you take the first step then the universe will take 100 steps towards you That if you write the first sentence, the next sentences will write themselves This is the art of letting go Of surrendering to the universal flow
